text: Abdul Ati al-Obeidi (; ; 10 October 1939 - 16 September 2023) was a Libyan politician. He worked in the cabinet of Muammar Gaddafi. He was Prime Minister from 1977 to 1979 and General Secretary of General People's Congress from 1979 to 1981. Al-Obeidi made one of his most remarkable contributions as a primary negotiator during Libyaâ€™s historic decision to renounce and dismantle its nuclear weapons program. On 31 August 2011, he was detained west of Tripoli by rebel forces. In June 2013, a court found him not guilty of a charge of mismanagement.Former Gaddafi official given senior position in Libyan eastern ruling body Middle East Monitor, April 3, 2017 Abdul Ati al-Obeidi died on 16 September 2023 in Tripoli, Libya from a heart attack at the age of 83. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Libya Category:Heads of state of Libya Category:Ambassadors of Libya
title: Abdul Ati al-Obeidi
